system.biography:
TitleFFF 206-4 Hunter Hodiri
Birthday14 Kelen 698
AppearanceAge 21, height 5’ 10”, heavy frame, weight 176 lbs, size 7, plain appearance, dark complexion, black hair, hazel eyes
Medical/PsycheScars on both cheeks and left forearm
Size7
ArmorLeather boots, leggings and tunic. Mail byrnie and round shield. Spear, battleaxe, short bow, quiver/12 arrows, knife.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
Valuables117d in silver in a money pouch
Notes

Biography

Brynn’s father, Aud, is the chief of the Temhui or “Iron Folk” Hodiri. Since Kjal Forsetha claimed the Barony of Geda, the two of them have grown to be friends. Aud has traded many horses directly to the Baron rather than taking them to the Lerenil or Burzyn horse fairs.

In 716, Brynn’s father arranged for him to stay with Baron Forsetha at Caer Geda. He told Brynn to learn the ways of the Chybisan people and the other “Shiny Hats”. His father believes that the future of the Hodiri lies with trade and alliance with the civilized peoples, not the conquest proposed by Jherdela.

Brynn has lived at Geda as part of the Baron’s entourage, raising and caring for horses, arranging horse trades, training for war with the huscarls, guiding hunting parties, and learning to appreciate Ivinian ale. He began his stay at Geda with the intent to learn everything he could and then share that information with Jherdela. It did not take long for his opinions to change. He is beginning to see his father’s wisdom and agrees that Jherdela may be following the wrong path. While the Hodiri outnumber the Chybisans, they serve as a useful buffer between the Hodiri and the rest of the “civilized” nations. Brynn believes that attacking Chybisa would only open the door for the Hodiri to be attacked the way the Solori have.

Until the arrival of Ygwelve, Brynn had been considering returning to his tribe. Since her arrival, he has been acting strangely. Smitten, he does not know exactly how to court Ygwelve, so he has been following the Hodiri way, demonstrating his skills at riding, hunting, and warfare. He has received just enough encouragement from her to continue with his pursuit.

Adventure Hooks

Looking for a Special Horse: PCs are in need of a horse with certain characteristics, a particular colour, size, temperament etc. Brynn is recommended as the man who can find it for them.

The Insult: Whether on purpose or by accident, one of the PCs has offered a grave insult to Brynn. Normally such things are settled violently by ritual combat, but he is willing to settle in a civilized manner, as soon as one of his friends will explain what that may be.

The Horse Race: Horse racing is an attraction at most large fairs and tournaments. Brynn has a very fast horse. A PC may be in the race. Someone might not like loosing money when that “barbarian” wins. PCs may be sent to “educate” him about his betters.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
